sub_title: Programme Development | Internal Communications | Belonging | Sustainability | DEI | Creating prosperous systems by building inclusive competencies
summary:
Results-driven and experienced leader with proven success in heading transformative, organisation-wide strategies and initiatives. I take an innovative and people-centric approach to resolving issues, developing new business opportunities and creating a culture of belonging. 

As a partner to HR, the board and other business stakeholders on inclusion and how to address this as a business priority, I am responsible for designing inclusion and diversity programmes linked to core values and cultural frameworks of various organisations, creating operational tools to build capability including inclusive behaviours. In all my efforts, the growth and development of colleagues, the organisations I work for and my own are a red thread.

A key foundation of my effectiveness is my commitment to collaborating with business leaders, cross-functional or cross-geographic partners, and stakeholders at all levels. Building relationships is essential in my role.  

Core skills include: driving change, internal communications, exploring possibilities to improve employee engagement practices, designing programmes including mutual mentoring and experiential training to build inclusive teams, advising employee resource group networks, foundations and organisations on how to maximise impact for their stakeholders and build L&D programmes to strengthen the inclusive competency of youth; in short, helping drive diversity and inclusion or simply offering a fresh perspective.

If you need someone to guide your team on their journey of change, someone to support them while they explore new concepts, reach out. There is a whole world of exciting possibilities out there, that can change the way business is being done today. To me, nothing is more thrilling than helping organisations and teams find their purpose, to help them maximise their impact by creating programmes that truly come to life in a meaningful and sustainable way.

school.name: HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)
HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)

projects.title: Young Professional Mentoring Programme Minds of Tomorrow
projects.description:
The Dutch Business Roundtable is a non-profit and has been active in the Dutch-Swiss community since 1995. The DBRT was created to help support the Dutch Embassy in Switzerland with promoting the interests of Dutch organisations and citizens in Switzerland and to further stimulate the economic relationship between our two countries. 

The DBRT is now one of the leading institutes in establishing new and strengthening existing relations between the Netherlands and Switzerland. This is done through organising network and knowledge-based events (with a touch of Dutch) for both CEOs and seasoned professionals throughout Switzerland.  

Starting 2017, I explored several other possibilities to amplify their environmental impact with a special focus on the position of the young professional working in Switzerland. We founded a young professional team dedicated to inspiring young professionals and bringing them together during special events and set up a special mentor project called Minds of Tomorrow.

The goal of the DBRT Minds of Tomorrow project is to stimulate young professionals, to increase their growth curve and to optimally use their own potential by connecting them with senior leaders active in the Swiss corporate life. A sub-goal of this project is to attract more young professionals to the activities of the professional Dutch network in Switzerland.

profile_positions.description:
As a Diversity and Inclusion specialist, my team and I have developed the All-in DEI school programmes for primary school and secondary schools alongside the All-in DEI sports programme for sports clubs.
Together, our programmes contain over 300 unique exercises for youth to build their inclusive competency,15 different workshops for teachers and coaches to create a more inclusive climate, and numerous frameworks for inclusive policies for schools and sports clubs! 

All of our programmes have been created in close collaboration with experts in sport psychology, diversity and inclusion practices, child psychology, and education.
profile_positions.title: Inclusion, Diversity & Belonging Specialist / Executive Board Member

profile_positions.description:
The research was focussed on studying the predictors of successful job sharing within Europe, working with companies like Unilever.

After researching the flexibility topics, the data showed that very little is known about the prerequisites of job sharing or about the predictors of a successful pairing.

Unknown variables, existing biases, the absence of (internationally-known) successful business cases, and the gap in current recruitment methodologies have led to a slow adaptation rate. 

This study resulted in a paper offering a broad understanding of what is needed to create a successful job share programme on either a national or international level.
profile_positions.title: Researcher Flexible Work Solutions (HR/DEI)

profile_positions.description:
Supported a wide variety of clients, mostly within the field of business services, as a freelance Senior Communications & Marketing consultant. Work activities varied from developing effective corporate communication strategies, defining routes-to-market for new products, writing articles on HR and communication, advising on labour market communication plans to designing corporate materials. 

Some of the brands I have worked for are Ricoh, Artflow, Easy Leads, Recruiting Roundtable, Studentenwerk, Durata International, Vital Orange, Mr-timmerwerken, VraagAmber, and Transparency Lab.
profile_positions.title: Senior Communication Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Governed the organisation and redefined its mission and purpose with the team, organised a variety of business events, and led various projects to support and strengthen DBRT’s business.
Advised the foundation on all communication, marketing, and, event-related activities, managed the Women in Business Group, and spearheaded the development of a special mentoring programme, connecting young talent to C-level professionals called Minds of Tomorrow. 

The DBRT itself organises business-related events with a touch of Dutch throughout Switzerland and has a strong focus on extending the professional networks of expats and international companies alike.
profile_positions.title: International Relations Manager

profile_positions.description:
Omnivers is a holding of several companies within the financial industry. 

In this position, I was responsible for all the existing brands.The brands I managed in terms of marketing and communication on a strategical, tactical and operational level were Extendum (consultancy firm and knowledge centre for over 600 accountancy firms within the Netherlands), Extendum Opleidingen (educational center for financial service providers), Extendum Audit (Auditing firm) and Stichting Accountancybelang ( Advocates for SMU firms). 

I was responsible for the modernisation of the corporate identity, development of new business, client communications, stakeholder communications, development and management of online and offline campaigns and media, managing the news stream, PR, collaborations with third parties and internal communications.

Successfully completed projects are among others: the introduction of Stichting Accountantsbelang, the long-term collaboration projects with the ING (market research and forecasting, joint promotional activities, knowledge management), the NBA (advocacy and knowledge
management) and joining ECABO (advocacy). But also the introduction of a new system for internal communication, creating new ways of knowledge sharing (internal) and creating several news streams on Accounting, Financial services, Law, HR, Payrolling and Marketing.
profile_positions.title: Corporate Communications Manager

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the strategic marketing and communications plan and translating the strategy into tactical and operational plans. Developed and implemented the new core programme for Dutch booksellers called “Lokale Held”. Created a new corporate website and co-wrote an e-book about local marketing techniques and store presentations for over 13.000 book stores. 

Successfully restructured the services of the employer and employee benefits and created a new proposition while also leading the contract negotiations and tenders. 

On an operational level: managed the online content and advised staff, the board, and the CEO concerning PR, propositions of services, and research. Designed productions and wrote the monthly newsletter as well as other member communications.
profile_positions.title: Communication Coordinator a.i.

profile_positions.description: Within PareX, I was responsible for the overall communications design and marketing on behalf of the brand on a strategic, tactical and operational level. Creating and amplifying the corporate identity was the core activity, online as well as offline.
profile_positions.title: Marketing and Communication Officer

profile_positions.description: I conducted research concerning the labour market and younger generations, like generation Y or 2.0. I wrote a manual regarding layout and design of communication in general. I worked on environmental analysis and internal analysis for our clients. I was co-responsible for the development and planning of communication reports for several clients on a strategic, tactical an operational level. My other responsibilities were editing, generating new business, concept design, and the development of new methods of analysis.
profile_positions.title: Labour Market Communications

profile_positions.description:
On behalf of the Randstad temp agency, I worked for several of its clients, amongst whom the police force, the district water board, an estate agent and an international bank. 

My job responsibilities were quite diverse. They were mostly supportive, like office management, clerical and administrative tasks and HR assistance. 

You might say I am pretty much an all-rounder.
profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description: I mainly gave advice to customers on fashion and sports equipment. Besides that, I managed the windows and maintained the store. When the owner and the general manager were absent, I managed the floor. Other than management I was responsible for handling complaints, orders and other business elements like registration of sales and opening and closing  the store. I also used to  advise the management regarding the staff.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Manager & Fashion Consultant

profile_positions.description: I was responsible for handling complaints and the translation of internal and external issues towards general management. I composed the work schedules for all employees and held evaluation interviews in order to collect the prevalent wishes and needs amongst the employees. The findings were reported to the board of directors. I was partly responsible for the selection and recruitment of personnel but my main responsibilities were the development of marketing activities, creating communication and the organisation of events for personnel and guests.
profile_positions.title: Communication Officer

volunteer_experiences.description: Temporary function for a non-profit organisation. I was responsible for the website, art collection and and the organisation of an art auction.
